page.title: 01THE AREA.
page.content: The area is rural and undulating, falling from Longridge Fell in the North to the Hodder and Ribble valleys in the South-East.The land is covered with grass and deciduous woodland. Hurst Green, with a population of a few hundred, is the largest village in the area.It has an hotel and filling station (just out of our area),two public houses, two cafes, and public conveniences. Mitton has very few houses, but its very old church is worth a visit on a Sunday afternoon. Stonyhurst is a small collection of teachers' houses near Stonyhurst College, a Catholic Public School.
